Patent Information.Abstract: The invention concerns antimicrobial peptides obtained from penaeid prawns having the following characteristics: a molecular mass of about 5 to 7 kDa; a pHi not less than 9; an N-terminal portion comprising a region (A) of about 15 to 25 amino acids rich in proline; and a C-terminal portion comprising a region (B) of about 20 to 30 amino acids and containing 6 cysteine residues forming three intramolecular disulfide bonds. The invention also concerns the nucleic acid sequences coding for said peptides and enabling their production by genetic engineering.

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-positive bacterium:Micrococcus luteus;Gram-negative bacterium:Escherichia coli.Fungi:Neurospora crassa, Fusarium oxysporum, Saccharomyces cerevisiae TGY.
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Tissue specificity: Higher expression in hemocytes and to a lesser extent in heart, testis, gills, intestine, lymphonoid organ and hepatopancreas. Traces in eyes and subcuticular epithelium. Not present in the brain.
Sequence Information.Developmental stage: Expression decreases 3 hours after microbial challenge to return to control levels after 12 hours and slightly increases after 24 hours.
Sequence Information.PTM: Contains three disulfide bonds 24-38; 27-45; 39-46 and Lysine amide at position 50.

Literature.Title: Penaeidins, a family of antimicrobial peptides from penaeid shrimp (Crustacea, Decapoda).
Literature.Author: Destoumieux D, Munoz M, Bulet P, Bachère E.

Literature.Title: Penaeidins, a new family of antimicrobial peptides isolated from the shrimp Penaeus vannamei (Decapoda).
Literature.Author: Destoumieux D, Bulet P, Loew D, Van Dorsselaer A, Rodriguez J, Bachère E.

Literature.Title: Recombinant expression and range of activity of penaeidins, antimicrobial peptides from penaeid shrimp.
Literature.Author: Destoumieux D, Bulet P, Strub JM, Van Dorsselaer A, Bachère E.
